sentence: Toda y the Federal Open Market C ommittee reaffirmed the current 0 to ¼ perc ent target range for the fede ral funds rate.
reason: This sentence indicates a neutral stance on US monetary policy as the Federal Open Market Committee reaffirms the current target range for the federal funds rate, suggesting no immediate changes.

sentence: Since the Committee last met in April, the  pace of job gains has picked u p and labor market conditions have improved somewhat further .
reason: This sentence suggests a positive development in the US labor market, indicating a potentially hawkish stance on US monetary policy. The improved labor market conditions and increased pace of job gains may lead to a tightening of monetary policy to prevent overheating.

sentence: Inflation has c ontinued to run  below our longer-run objective, but some of the downward pressure  on inflation re sulting from e arlier sharp declines in energy prices is abating.
reason: This sentence suggests a dovish stance on US monetary policy. It acknowledges that inflation is below the longer-run objective, but also indicates that the downward pressure on inflation caused by energy price declines is diminishing. This implies that the FOMC may consider maintaining or even easing its current monetary policy stance.

sentence: The Committee continues to judge that the f irst increase in the federal funds rate will be appropriate when it  has seen further improvement i n the labor market and is reasonably confident that infla tion will move back to its 2 per cent objective over the medium term.
reason: This sentence suggests a neutral stance on US monetary policy. The Committee is waiting for further improvement in the labor market and confidence in inflation returning to its 2% objective before considering the first increase in the federal funds rate.

sentence: At our meeting that ended today, the Committee concluded  that these conditions have not yet been achieved.
reason: This sentence suggests a dovish stance on US monetary policy as it indicates that the Committee believes the desired conditions for a change in policy have not been met. This implies a cautious approach and a reluctance to make any hawkish moves in the near future.

sentence: It remains th e case that the Committee will  determine the timing of the initial increase in the federal funds r ate on a meeting-by-meeting basi s, depending on its assessment of incoming economic information and its implications for the econ omic outlook.
reason: This sentence suggests a neutral stance on US monetary policy. The Committee will decide the timing of the initial increase in the federal funds rate based on incoming economic information and its implications for the economic outlook, indicating a data-dependent approach rather than a predetermined hawkish or dovish bias.

sentence: Let me emphasize that the importance of  the initial increase should no t be overstated:  The stance of monetary policy will likely remain highly accommodative for qui te some time after the initial increase in the federal funds rat e in order to s upport continue d progress toward our objectives of maximum employment and 2 percent inflation.
reason: This sentence suggests a dovish stance on US monetary policy. It emphasizes that the initial increase in the federal funds rate should not be overemphasized and that the stance of monetary policy will remain highly accommodative for a considerable period to support continued progress towards employment and inflation objectives.

sentence: I will come back t o today’s policy decision in a few moments, but first I would lik e to review recent economic d evelopments and the outlook.
reason: This sentence is irrelevant to US monetary policy as it does not provide any indication of a hawkish, dovish, or neutral stance. It simply suggests that the speaker will discuss recent economic developments and the outlook before addressing the policy decision.

sentence: The U.S. economy hit a soft patc h earlier this year; real gross  domestic product looks to have changed little in the fir st quarter.
reason: This sentence suggests that the U.S. economy experienced a temporary slowdown in the first quarter, with little change in real gross domestic product. It is irrelevant to US monetary policy as it does not provide any indication of a hawkish, dovish, or neutral stance.

sentence: Growth in household spending slowed, business fixed investment edged down, and net export s were a substantial drag on growth.
reason: This sentence suggests a slowdown in household spending, a decrease in business fixed investment, and a significant negative impact from net exports on economic growth. These factors indicate a potentially negative outlook for the US economy, which could influence a more dovish stance on US monetary policy.

sentence: Despite the soft first quarter, the fundamentals underlying househol d spending appear favorable, an d consumer sentiment remains June 17, 2015 Chair Yellen’s Press Conference FINAL  Page 2 of 23  solid.
reason: This sentence suggests that despite a weak first quarter, the overall conditions for household spending are positive, and consumer sentiment is strong. This indicates a neutral stance on US monetary policy as it does not lean towards being hawkish or dovish.

sentence: Looking ahead, the Committee still expects a moderate p ace of GDP growth, with continuing job gains and lower energy prices supporting househo ld spending.
reason: This sentence suggests a neutral stance on US monetary policy. The Committee anticipates a moderate pace of GDP growth, supported by job gains and lower energy prices, indicating a balanced approach without any strong hawkish or dovish implications.

sentence: The labor market data so far this year have shown further progr ess toward our objective of maximum employment, although a t a slower pace than late last  year.
reason: This sentence suggests a neutral stance on US monetary policy. It acknowledges progress in the labor market towards maximum employment, but highlights a slower pace compared to the previous year.

sentence: Over the past three months, job gains have averaged about 210,000 per month, down f rom an average pace of 280,000 per month over the second hal f of last year, but still well above the pace consistent with trend labor force growth.
reason: This sentence suggests a slowdown in job gains compared to the previous year, but the current pace is still above the level associated with trend labor force growth. It is neutral in terms of US monetary policy as it does not provide a clear indication of whether the Federal Open Market Committee (FOMC) should adopt a hawkish or dovish stance.

sentence: Alt hough the unemployment rate, at 5 .5 percent in May, was unchanged from the latest readi ng available at the time of our April meeting, the labor force participation rate edged up.
reason: This sentence suggests a dovish stance on US monetary policy. Despite the unchanged unemployment rate, the increase in labor force participation rate indicates a potential improvement in the job market. This could imply a need for continued accommodative measures to support economic growth.

sentence: A broader measure of unemployment  that includes individuals who want and are available to wor k but have not actively searched r ecently and people who are working part time but would rather work full time has continued  to improve.
reason: This sentence suggests that the broader measure of unemployment, which includes individuals who want to work but haven't actively searched recently and those working part-time but desiring full-time employment, has shown improvement. This indicates a positive trend in the labor market, which could be seen as a dovish signal for US monetary policy.

sentence: But it seems likely that some cyclical weakness in the labor market remains:  The p articipation rate remains below most estimates of its underlyi ng trend, involuntary part-time e mployment remains elevated, and wage growth remains relat ively subdued.
reason: This sentence suggests a dovish stance on US monetary policy. The mention of cyclical weakness in the labor market, low participation rate, elevated involuntary part-time employment, and subdued wage growth indicates that the FOMC may prioritize accommodative measures to stimulate the economy.

sentence: Inflation has continued to r un below our longer-run objective, in part reflecting lower energy prices.
reason: This sentence suggests a dovish stance on US monetary policy. The mention of inflation running below the longer-run objective indicates a concern for weak price growth. Additionally, attributing it to lower energy prices implies that the central bank may not view this as a persistent issue, making it irrelevant for immediate policy adjustments.

sentence: Declines in import  prices have also restrained inflation.
reason: This sentence suggests that the declines in import prices have had a restraining effect on inflation. As a result, it implies a dovish stance on US monetary policy, as it indicates that inflationary pressures are being contained, which may reduce the need for aggressive tightening measures.

sentence: However, energy prices appear to have stabilized recen tly.
reason: This sentence is irrelevant to US monetary policy as it does not provide any indication of the stance or direction of the policy. It simply states that energy prices have recently stabilized, without any implications on whether the policy will be hawkish, dovish, or neutral.

sentence: My colleagues and I contin ue to expect that as the effects of these transitory factors dissipa te and as the labor market impr oves further, inflation will gradually move back toward our 2 p ercent objective over the med ium term.
reason: This sentence suggests a neutral stance on US monetary policy. The expectation is that inflation will gradually move back towards the 2 percent objective as transitory factors dissipate and the labor market improves further.

sentence: Market-based measures of inflation compensa tion remain low, though they have  risen some from their levels earlier this year, and survey-ba sed measures of longer-term inf lation expectations have remained stable.
reason: This sentence suggests a neutral stance on US monetary policy. While market-based measures of inflation compensation have increased slightly, they still remain low. Additionally, survey-based measures of longer-term inflation expectations have remained stable, indicating no significant shift towards a hawkish or dovish stance.

sentence: The Committee will continue to monitor inflation devel opments carefully.
reason: This sentence suggests a neutral stance on US monetary policy. The Committee's commitment to closely monitoring inflation developments indicates a cautious approach, neither leaning towards a hawkish nor dovish stance at this point.

sentence: June 17, 2015 Chair Yellen’s Press Conference FINAL  Page 3 of 23  This assessment of the outlook is reflected in the individual e conomic projections submitted for this meeting by FOMC participants.
reason: This sentence indicates that the individual economic projections submitted by FOMC participants reflect their assessment of the outlook. sentence: As always, ea ch participant’s projections are conditioned on his or her own view  of appropriate monetary poli cy.
reason: This sentence implies a neutral stance on US monetary policy. It suggests that each participant's projections are based on their own perspective of what constitutes appropriate monetary policy, indicating a diversity of views within the FOMC.

sentence: For economic growth, participants reduced their proj ections for this year, in line w ith the disappointing data for the first quarter.
reason: This sentence suggests a dovish stance on US monetary policy. The reduction in projections for economic growth, in line with disappointing first-quarter data, indicates a cautious approach towards tightening monetary policy, reflecting a concern for supporting the economy rather than adopting a hawkish stance.

sentence: The central tendency of  the growth projections for 20 15 is now 1.8 to 2.0 percent, down a little more than ½ percentage po int from the March projection s.  The central tendency rises to 2.4 to 2.7 percent next year, somewhat above estimates of the l onger-run growth rate.
reason: This sentence suggests a dovish stance on US monetary policy. The downward revision of growth projections for 2015 indicates a cautious approach, while the projected increase for next year implies a slightly more optimistic outlook. However, the mention of longer-run growth rate being exceeded suggests a neutral stance.

sentence: The unemployment rate projections for  this year are a little higher  than in March.
reason: This sentence suggests a slightly hawkish stance on US monetary policy. The higher unemployment rate projections indicate a potential slowdown in the economy, which may prompt the Federal Reserve to adopt a more cautious or neutral approach in their monetary policy decisions.

sentence: At the end of this year, the central tendency for t he unemployment rate stands at 5.2 to 5.3 percent, a bit above participants’ estimates of the  longer-run normal unemployment r ate.
reason: This sentence suggests a dovish stance on US monetary policy. The central tendency for the unemployment rate being slightly above the longer-run normal rate indicates that the Federal Open Market Committee (FOMC) may maintain an accommodative stance to support economic recovery.

sentence: Committee participants generally see the unemployment ra te declining a little further over the course of 2016 and 2017.
reason: This sentence suggests a dovish stance on US monetary policy as it indicates that the Committee expects the unemployment rate to continue decreasing in the near future. This implies a potential need for accommodative measures to support economic growth.

sentence: Finally, FOMC participants projec t inflation to be quite low th is year, largely reflecting lower energy and non-energy import prices .
reason: This sentence suggests a dovish stance on US monetary policy. The projection of low inflation, driven by lower energy and non-energy import prices, indicates a cautious approach by the FOMC, which may lead to a more accommodative monetary policy to support economic growth.

sentence: The central tendency of t he inflation projections for this year is below 1 percent, unchanged since March.
reason: This sentence suggests a dovish stance on US monetary policy. The fact that the central tendency of inflation projections for this year remains below 1 percent and unchanged since March indicates a cautious approach, implying a likelihood of continued accommodative measures to support economic growth.

sentence: As the transit ory factors holding down inflation abate, the central  tendency rises to 1.6 to 1.9 perce nt next year and to 1.9 to 2.0 percent in 2017.
reason: This sentence suggests a hawkish stance on US monetary policy as it indicates that as the temporary factors suppressing inflation diminish, the central tendency for inflation is projected to rise steadily over the next two years.

sentence: Returning to monetary policy, as I noted, the Committee reaffir med its view that the current 0 to ¼ percent target ra nge for the federal funds rate remains appropriate.
reason: This sentence indicates a neutral stance on US monetary policy. The Committee reaffirmed its view that the current target range for the federal funds rate (0 to ¼ percent) is still appropriate, suggesting no immediate changes in interest rates.

sentence: As we said in our statement, the decision to rai se the target range will depe nd on our assessment of realized and expected progress toward our o bjectives of maximum employme nt and 2 percent inflation.
reason: This sentence indicates that the decision to raise the target range for US monetary policy will be dependent on the Federal Open Market Committee's assessment of progress towards their objectives of maximum employment and 2 percent inflation. It is a neutral statement as it does not explicitly lean towards a hawkish or dovish stance.

sentence: We continue to base that assessm ent on a wide range of informat ion, including measures of labor market conditions, indicators of  inflation pressures and inflat ion expectations, and readings on financial and international de velopments.
reason: This sentence suggests that the FOMC is taking a neutral stance on US monetary policy. They are considering various factors such as labor market conditions, inflation pressures, inflation expectations, and financial and international developments to make their assessment.

sentence: And we continue to a nticipate that it will be June 17, 2015 Chair Yellen’s Press Conference FINAL  Page 4 of 23  appropriate to raise the target range for the federal funds rat e when the Committee has seen further improvement in the labor  market and is reasonably confi dent that inflation will move back to its 2 percent objectiv e over the medium term.
reason: This sentence suggests a hawkish stance on US monetary policy. The FOMC anticipates raising the target range for the federal funds rate when there is further improvement in the labor market and confidence that inflation will reach its 2 percent objective.

sentence: Even so, the Committee judged that economic conditions do not yet warrant an increase in the federal funds rate.
reason: This sentence suggests a dovish stance on US monetary policy as it indicates that despite the economic conditions, the Committee does not see a need for an increase in the federal funds rate at the moment.

sentence: While the Committee views the disappoi nting economic performance in t he first quarter as largely transitory, my colleagues and I  would like to see more decisive  evidence that a moderate pace of economic growth will be sustained, so that conditions in the la bor market will continue to improve and inflation will move back to 2 percent.
reason: This sentence suggests a neutral stance on US monetary policy. The Committee acknowledges the disappointing economic performance in the first quarter but considers it temporary. They express the need for more evidence of sustained economic growth to ensure improvement in the labor market and inflation returning to the target, indicating a cautious approach.

sentence: Once we begin to remove policy acc ommodation, we continue to ex pect that—as we say in our statement—“even after emp loyment and inflation are near mandate-consistent levels, economic conditions may, for some time, warrant keeping the tar get federal funds rate below levels the Committee views as normal in the longer run.”  In other words, alt hough policy will be data dependent, economic conditions  are currently anticipated t o evolve in a manner that will warrant only gradual increases in the target federal funds rate .
reason: This sentence suggests a dovish stance on US monetary policy. It indicates that even after employment and inflation reach desired levels, economic conditions may still require keeping the target federal funds rate below normal levels. This implies a cautious approach with only gradual increases in interest rates.

sentence: Compared with the projections mad e in March, most FOMC particip ants lowered somewhat their paths for the fede ral funds rate, consistent wit h the revisions made to the projections for GDP growth and the  unemployment rate.
reason: This sentence suggests a dovish stance on US monetary policy as most FOMC participants have lowered their projections for the federal funds rate, aligning with revised projections for GDP growth and the unemployment rate.

sentence: The medi an projection for the federal funds rate continues to point to a first increase later this ye ar, with the rate rising to about 1¾ percent in late 2016 and 2¾ pe rcent in late 2017.
reason: This sentence suggests a hawkish stance on US monetary policy as it indicates an expectation of increasing the federal funds rate in the future, reaching 1¾ percent in late 2016 and 2¾ percent in late 2017.

sentence: In 2016 a nd 2017, the median path is about ¼ percentage point below that pr ojected in March.
reason: This sentence suggests a dovish stance on US monetary policy as it indicates a downward revision in the projected median path for 2016 and 2017, implying a more cautious approach towards interest rate hikes.

sentence: The median p rojected rate in 2017 remains below the 3¾ percent or so projec ted by most FOMC participants as the longer-run value of the federal funds rate even though the  central tendency of the unem ployment rate by that time is June 17, 2015 Chair Yellen’s Press Conference FINAL  Page 5 of 23  slightly below its estimated l onger-run value and the central t endency for inflati on is close to our 2 percent objective.
reason: This sentence suggests a dovish stance on US monetary policy. The projected rate for 2017 is below the longer-run value of the federal funds rate, despite the unemployment rate being slightly below its estimated longer-run value and inflation being close to the 2 percent objective.

sentence: Participant s provided a number of explana tions for the federal funds rate running below its normal longer-run l evel at that time.
reason: This sentence suggests that the participants discussed reasons for the federal funds rate being below its normal longer-run level. It is neutral as it does not indicate a specific stance on US monetary policy, but rather provides an explanation for the current situation.

sentence: These included, in particular, the residual effects of the financial crisis , which are likely to continue t o constrain spending and credit availability for some time.
reason: This sentence suggests that the residual effects of the financial crisis will continue to limit spending and credit availability. It implies a dovish stance on US monetary policy as it highlights the need for accommodative measures to support economic recovery.

sentence: I would like to emphasize that the forecasts of the appropriate  path of the federal funds rate are conditional on participants’ individual projections of  the most likely outcomes for economic growth, employment, inflation, and other factors.
reason: This sentence is neutral as it highlights the importance of individual projections in determining the appropriate path of the federal funds rate. It does not provide any indication of a hawkish or dovish stance, making it irrelevant to US monetary policy implications.

sentence: But  our actual policy decisions over time will depend on evolving economic conditions.
reason: This sentence suggests a neutral stance on US monetary policy. It indicates that the FOMC's policy decisions will be influenced by changing economic conditions, implying a flexible approach rather than a predetermined hawkish or dovish bias.

sentence: Accordingly,  if the expansion proves to be more vigorous than currently an ticipated and inflation moves hi gher than expected, then the appropriate path would likely fo llow a steeper a nd higher traje ctory; conversely, if conditions were to prove weaker, then the a ppropriate tra jectory would be lower and less steep.
reason: This sentence suggests that the FOMC's monetary policy will be responsive to changes in economic conditions. If the expansion and inflation exceed expectations, the policy would likely be more hawkish, with a steeper and higher trajectory. Conversely, if conditions weaken, the policy would be more dovish, with a lower and less steep trajectory.

sentence: Finally, the Committee will continue its policy of reinvesting proceeds from maturing Treasury securities a nd principal payments from agency debt and  mortgage-backed securities.
reason: This sentence is irrelevant to US monetary policy as it does not provide any indication of a change in the stance. sentence: The Committee’s sizable holdings  of longer-term securities shou ld help maintain accommodative financial conditions and promot e further progress toward our ob jectives.
reason: This sentence suggests a dovish stance on US monetary policy. The Committee's sizable holdings of longer-term securities are expected to maintain accommodative financial conditions, indicating a supportive approach towards stimulating economic growth and progress towards their objectives.

sentence: Well, there are  obviously a range of opinions, b oth in the market and among Committee members, at this time on what the appropriate s tance of policy is likely to be later this year and next year.
reason: This sentence suggests that there is a divergence of opinions within the market and among Committee members regarding the future stance of US monetary policy. sentence: But , importantly, the—when the people write down their dots in the SEP, they’re making forecasts a bout what unfolding data is like ly to show.
reason: This sentence is irrelevant to US monetary policy as it discusses the process of making forecasts based on unfolding data. It does not provide any indication of a hawkish, dovish, or neutral stance on monetary policy.

sentence: For all of us, the appropri ate policy decision is going to be d ata dependent, and all of us will be looking at incoming data .
reason: This sentence suggests a neutral stance on US monetary policy. It emphasizes the importance of data in making policy decisions and indicates that all members will be closely monitoring incoming data.

sentence: Differences in the appropriate assessments of the appropriate stance of policy—in addition to reflecting different views on the outlook, there are a s et of risks that all of us n eed to weigh in judging on the—judging the appropriate time of t he beginning of normalization.

sentence: On the one hand, waiting too long to begin normalization can r isk significan tly overshooting  our inflation objective given the lags in the operation of mone tary policy.
reason: This sentence suggests a hawkish stance on US monetary policy. It implies that delaying the start of normalization could lead to a significant overshooting of the inflation objective, highlighting the importance of taking action in a timely manner.

sentence: And, on the other ha nd, beginning too early could risk derailing a recovery that we ha ve worked for a very long time t o try to achieve.
reason: This sentence suggests a cautious approach to US monetary policy. It implies a dovish stance as it emphasizes the risk of derailing the recovery if the policy is initiated too early, indicating a preference for maintaining a supportive stance.

sentence: And so we’re trying to assess those risks.
reason: This sentence suggests that the FOMC is actively evaluating potential risks. It is a neutral statement as it does not indicate a specific stance on US monetary policy.

sentence: But I want to emphasize, sometimes too much attention is placed  on the timing of the first increase in the federal  funds rate.
reason: This sentence is neutral as it acknowledges that excessive focus on the timing of the first increase in the federal funds rate is not necessary. It does not provide any indication of a hawkish or dovish stance, making it irrelevant to US monetary policy implications.

sentence: And what should matt er to market participants is the entire trajectory, the entire expected trajectory of policy.
reason: This sentence suggests that market participants should focus on the complete expected trajectory of policy, indicating a neutral stance. sentence: A nd, again, while our actual policy decisions will have to evolve in  light of what really does happ en in the economy, the Committee, as you can see by the SEP projections , currently anticipates th at conditions will evolve in the economy in a manner that will make  it appropriate to raise the federal funds rate gradually over time.
reason: This sentence suggests a hawkish stance on US monetary policy. The Committee anticipates that economic conditions will evolve in a way that justifies a gradual increase in the federal funds rate.

sentence: Well, it’ s a judgment that the Committee is—will  have to make, and, as I’ve said previously and as we ’ve said in the statement, it will depend on a wide range of data and not on any simple indicators .
reason: This sentence suggests a neutral stance on US monetary policy. The Committee acknowledges that the decision will depend on various data and not solely on straightforward indicators. sentence: So I can’t provide you—it wo uld be wrong for me to provide you a roadmap that said something as simple as, if the unemploy ment rate declines to X, that then the labor market will ha ve improved enough for us to begin  to raise policy.
reason: This sentence suggests a dovish stance on US monetary policy. sentence: Obviously, we have to look at the pace of job creation.

sentence: We hav e to look at what’s happening to labor force particip ation, to part-time employment  for economic reasons, to job openings, to the pace of quits, t o wage inflation, and other in dicators of the state of the labor market.

sentence: I did say when we agreed that labor market slack has d iminished to some extent in the intermeeting period, and, clearl y, over a longer span of time, over the last several years, obviously we’ve made considerab le progress in moving toward our  goal of maximum employment.

sentence: So, in spite of the f act that there is some progre ss on that front, the Committee wants to see some further progre ss before feeling that it will be appropriate to raise rates.

sentence: The  big declines in energy prices came toward the end of last year and the beginning of this year , and they’re not going to wash o ut of the inflation data until late in this year.

sentence: We issued a normalization state ment giving principles of normal izing policy, and what we said at that time is that we expected  to reduce or cease reinvestmen t at some time after we had begun the process of normalizing polic y by raising our target for the  federal funds rate.
